page.title: 06A VICAR'S WEEK, GRAYS
page.content: An interview with our local vicar revealed that contrary to popular belief - he does not work on Sundays only.He gets up at 6.30,has breakfast and then reads his Bible.He discusses the readings with his wife,then they pray together.He leaves the vicarage to take assembly at two nearby schools, or to attend parish meetings. In the afternoon he visits the local hospice to discuss fund raising and talk to the patients.There are three services held in the church every Sunday.Each year there are one about one hundred funerals,fifty baptisms and twenty weddings.Usually his congregation consists of approximately one hundred and fifty people,although when the church was featured on Songs of Praise on television, it soared to four hundred and fifty.
